     Question               Answers                          Notes                  Total
1.     a                                    Accept values in the range of 21.2 to
                                            21.6 °C.




                                                                                     1




                21.4 °C ✔
                                                                            –4–                                   N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                                    Notes                 Total
1.     b        29.0 «°C» ✔                                                                      Accept range 28.8 to 29.2 °C.           1

1.     c        ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                    Accept values of volume in range
                                                                                                 25.5 to 26.5 cm3.
                «volume CH3COOH =» 26.0 «cm3» ✔

                                                                3
                                                      50.0 cm                                    Award [2] for correct final answer.
                «[CH3COOH] = 0.995 mol dm–3                    3
                                                                  =» 1.91 «mol dm−3» ✔
                                                      26.0 cm
                                                                                                                                         2
                ALTERNATIVE 2
                «n(NaOH) =0.995 mol dm-3  0.0500 dm3 =» 0.04975 «mol» ✔
                               0.04975
                «[CH3COOH] =             dm3 =» 1.91 «mol dm-3» ✔
                                0.0260

1.     d    i   «total volume  50.0  26.0 » 76.0 cm3 AND «temperature change 29.0  21.4 » Award [2] for correct final answer.
                7.6 «°C» ✔                                                                                                               2
                «q  0.0760 kg    4.18 kJ kg–1 K–1    7.6 K » 2.4 «kJ» ✔
                                                                          –5–                                     N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                                                   Notes                 Total
1.     d    ii   «n(NaOH)  0.995 mol dm-3  0.0500 dm3 » 0.04975 «mol»
                 OR
                 «n(CH3COOH)  1.91 mol dm-3  0.0260 dm3 » 0.04966 «mol» ✔                                                            2
                                                                                                 Award [2] for correct final answer.
                              2.4 kJ
                 «H                   »  48 /  49 «kJ mol–1» ✔                           Negative sign is required for M2.
                            0.04975 mol

1.     e    i    «initially steep because» greatest concentration/number of particles at start
                 OR
                 «slope decreases because» concentration/number of particles decreases ✔
                                                                                                                                         2
                 volume produced per unit of time depends on frequency of collisions
                 OR
                 rate depends on frequency of collisions ✔

1.     e    ii   mass/amount/concentration of metal carbonate more in X
                 OR                                                                                                                      1
                 concentration/amount of CH3COOH more in X ✔
                                                                      –6–                                         N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                     Answers                                                      Notes                    Total
2.     a        increasing number of protons
                OR
                increasing nuclear charge ✔


                «atomic» radius/size decreases
                OR
                                                                                                                                         2
                same number of shells
                OR
                similar shielding «by inner electrons» ✔


                «greater energy needed to overcome increased attraction between nucleus and
                electrons»

2.     b        atomic/ionic radius increases ✔
                                                                                               Do not accept discussion of attraction
                smaller charge density 
                                                                                               between valence electrons and
                OR                                                                             nucleus for M2.                           2
                                                                                               Accept “weaker metallic bonds” for M2.
                force of attraction between metal ions and delocalised electrons decreases ✔


2.     c        P4O10 (s)  6H2O (l)  4H3PO4 (aq) ✔                                           Accept “P4O10 (s)  2H2O (l) 
                                                                                               4HPO3(aq)” (initial reaction).            1

2.     d        «series of» lines                                                              M1 and/or M2 may be shown on a
                OR                                                                             diagram.
                                                                                                                                         2
                only certain frequencies/wavelengths ✔
                convergence at high«er» frequency/energy/short«er» wavelength ✔
                                                                          –7–                                             N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                                            Notes                    Total
2.     e    i     Mn ✔                                                                                                                              1

2.     e    ii    Mn(s)  Ni2+(aq)  Ni(s)  Mn2+(aq) ✔                                                                                             1

2.     e    iii   wire between electrodes AND labelled salt bridge in contact with both electrolytes ✔   Electrodes can be connected directly or
                                                                                                         through voltmeter/ammeter/light bulb,
                  anions to right (salt bridge)                                                          but not a battery/power supply.
                  OR
                                                                                                         Accept ions or a specific salt as the
                  cations to left (salt bridge)                                                          label of the salt bridge.
                  OR
                  arrow from Mn to Ni (on wire or next to it) ✔



                                                                                                                                                    2
                                                                        –8–                       N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                       Notes                    Total
3.     a                                                                          Accept any combination of dots,
                                          PF3                         PF4+        crosses and lines.
                                                                                  Ignore missing brackets and positive
                                                                                  charge.
                                                                                  Penalize missing lone pairs once only.
                  Lewis
                  structure                            ✔                          Do not apply ECF for molecular            4
                                                                                  geometry.


                                                                              ✔
                  Molecular     trigonal pyramidal ✔       tetrahedral ✔
                  geometry

3.     b        polar AND bond polarities/dipoles do not cancel out               Apply ECF from part (a) molecular
                OR                                                                geometry.                                 1
                polar AND unsymmetrical distribution of charge ✔
                                                                                –9–                     N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                               Answers                                     Notes                       Total
4.     a                     0.4490 g                                                  Award [3] for correct final answer.
                carbon: «                 –1
                                               »  0.01020 «mol» / 0.1225 «g»
                            44.01 g mol
                OR
                              0.1840  2
                hydrogen: «              »  0.02042 «mol» / 0.0206 «g» ✔
                                18.02                                                                                                3

                oxygen: «0.1595 – (0.1225  0.0206)»  0.0164 «g» / 0.001025 «mol» ✔


                empirical formula: C10H20O ✔

4.     b        temperature  423 K                                                    Award [1] for correct answer with no
                OR                                                                     working shown.
                     mRT                                                                                            m
                M=       ✔                                                            Accept “pV = nRT AND n =         ” for M1.
                      pV                                                                                            M
                                                                                                                                     2

                       0.150 g  8.31JK –1mol–1  423 K
                «M =                                     » 156 «g mol–1» ✔
                           100.2 kPa  0.0337 dm3
                                                                         – 10 –                                      N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                         Notes                    Total
5.     a                                      Effect                       Reason                    Award [1 max] if both effects are
                  Increasing the volume, at   none/no effect      AND      same number of «gas»      correct.
                  constant temperature                                     moles/molecules on both
                                                                           sides ✔                   Reason for increasing volume:
                  Increasing the              moves to left        AND     «forward» reaction is     Accept “concentration of all reagents      2
                  temperature, at constant                                 exothermic ✔              reduced by an equal amount so cancels
                  pressure                                                                           out in Kc expression”.
                                                                                                     Accept “affects both forward and
                                                                                                     backward rates equally”.

5.     b    i     HCO3– AND H2O ✔                                                                                                               1

5.     b    ii    species that has one less proton/H ion «than its conjugate acid»                  Do not accept “differs by one proton/H+
                                                                                                     from conjugate acid”.
                  OR
                  species that forms its conjugate acid by accepting a proton                                                                   1
                  OR
                  species that is formed when an acid donates a proton ✔

5.     b    iii   oxide ion/O2– ✔                                                                                                               1
                                                                         – 11 –                        N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                          Notes                 Total
5.     c        insufficient data to make generalization
                OR
                need to consider a «much» larger number of acids
                OR
                hypothesis will continue to be tested with new acids to see if it can stand the test
                of time ✔


                «hypothesis is false as» other acids/HCl/HBr/HCN/transition metal ion/BF3 do not
                contain oxygen                                                                                              2 max
                OR
                other acids/HCl/HBr/HCN/transition metal ion/BF3 falsify hypothesis ✔


                correct inductive reasoning «based on limited sample» ✔


                «hypothesis not valid as» it contradicts current/accepted theories/Brønsted-
                Lowry/Lewis theory ✔
                                                                      – 12 –                                     N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                      Notes                   Total
6.     a    i     oxidation/redox AND acidified «potassium» dichromate(VI)                      Accept “acidified «potassium»
                  OR                                                                            dichromate” OR “«acidified potassium»
                                                                                                permanganate”.
                                                                                                                                          1
                  oxidation/redox AND «acidified potassium» manganate(VII) ✔
                                                                                                Accept name or formula of the
                                                                                                reagent(s).

6.     a    ii    ALTERNATIVE 1 using K2Cr2O7:
                  Compound A: orange to green AND secondary hydroxyl                            Award [1] for “A: orange to green AND
                                                                                                B: no change”.
                  OR
                                                                                                Award [1] for “A: secondary hydroxyl
                  Compound A: orange to green AND hydroxyl oxidized «by chromium(VI) ions» ✔
                                                                                                AND B: tertiary hydroxyl”.

                  Compound B: no change AND tertiary hydroxyl «not oxidized by chromium(VI)
                  ions» ✔
                                                                                                Accept “alcohol” for “hydroxyl”.
                                                                                                                                          2
                  ALTERNATIVE 2 using KMnO4:
                  Compound A: purple to colourless AND secondary hydroxyl
                                                                                                Award [1] for “A: purple to colourless
                  OR                                                                            AND B: no change”
                  Compound A: purple to colourless AND hydroxyl oxidized «by manganese(VII)     Award [1] for “A: secondary hydroxyl
                  ions» ✔                                                                       AND B: tertiary hydroxyl”.
                                                                                                Accept “purple to brown” for A.
                  Compound B: no change AND tertiary hydroxyl «not oxidized by manganese(VII)
                  ions» ✔

6.     a    iii          Compound             Number of signals             Ratio of areas      Accept ratio of areas in any order.
                            A                5✔                        6:1:1:1:1✔              Do not apply ECF for ratios.              4
                            B                4✔                        6:1:1:2✔
                                                         – 13 –                    N17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                  Answers                             Notes                      Total
6.     b        Initiation:                                       Reference to UV/hν/heat not required.
                Br2 
                         2Br• ✔
                        UV / hv / heat
                                                                  Accept representation of radical without
                                                                  • (eg, Br, C2H5) if consistent throughout
                                                                  mechanism.
                Propagation:
                Br•  C2H6  C2H5•  HBr ✔                        Accept further bromination.
                C2H5•  Br2  C2H5Br  Br• ✔                      Award [3 max] if initiation, propagation
                                                                  and termination are not stated or are        4
                                                                  incorrectly labelled for equations.
                Termination:
                Br•  Br•  Br2                                   Award [3 max] if methane is used
                OR                                                instead of ethane, and/or chlorine is
                                                                  used instead of bromine.
                C2H5•  Br•  C2H5Br
                OR
                C2H5•  C2H5•  C4H10 ✔
